result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Craft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 AMENDED FROM Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Seek and maintain full-time, verifiable employment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with any assessments determined appropriate and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Attend restitution hearing scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 2:30 p.m.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sorbriety is required.

Restitution to be determined at hearing scheduled for October 9, 2014.  RESTITUTION DETERMINED 10/09/2014.  $1,800.00 HELD BY RACINE POLICE DEPT TO BE APPLIED TO RESTITUTION.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
